newsitem.title: JAPAN: FORECAST - Tokyo CPI seen up 1.3 pct in May.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Tokyo CPI seen up 1.3 pct in May.

text.p: Consumer prices in Tokyo are expected to rise by slightly more than one percent in May, indicating that prices have remained stable despite the April 1 increase in Japan's sales tax, a Reuters poll shows.

Based on on average of economists' forecasts, the consumer price index (CPI) in Tokyo is expected to show a year-on-year rise of 1.3 percent in May while the CPI for the entire nation for April is projected to rise by 1.7 percent.
On a month-on-month basis, the Tokyo CPI is seen up 0.2 percent in May, while economists forecast a 1.7 percent rise in the nationwide CPI for April.

"The effects of the sales tax increase on prices were seen mostly in April, and prices are now stable," said an economist at Sanwa Research Institute. Japan's consumption tax was raised to five percent from three percent on April 1.
The CPI figures are scheduled to be released on May 30.
